Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: The more I learn about UTXOs, the more broken coins without them seem. @grewalsatinder ETH people assume there is "global state" for smart contracts, and so I think that is why "stateless" is like a "bad word" to them, it don't jive with their ecosystem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CC seems to have plenty of state to me. the hard part is properly constraining the vin/vout to make validation as simple as possible

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe the traditional way of looking at smart contracts is too limited?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Maybe because dapps need a state.  Apart from a wallet being completely stateful, not many further dapps exist with utxo only.


Cannot write many dapps with utxo only, but CC opens up a whole new world of possibilities as we‚Äôve seen already in 6 months of half a handful of devs working on it.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: CC solves it because any object can be encoded to the CCvout format.  Objects have state through their mutable fields which are exposed by RPC methods (like getters and setters and general functions)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: opreturn

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: plenty of room for state info in opreturn

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess if you look at pure definition of utxo, there is no opreturn

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i prefer to look at what is possible

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
i have a problem i'd like to solve with a CC.

1.  i don't like claiming my 5% active user.
2.  i'd like to send funds to a myCC address and they are safe there (locked)
3.  i'd like the funds in (2) released back to original sender address when another deposit is made of more than 1 KMD e.g. 1.0005 from the same originating sender address
4.  whilst funds are locked, i'd like to periodically send a tx less than 1 KMD e.g. 0.0005 to myCC to check if 10k blocks has passed since last activity on the funds, and if so, claim the 5% reward.

possible?

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
start a new chain 
then start a separate node with something like this appended to the chain params
```
-datadir="/<user>/.komodo2" -rpcport=1234 -listen=0 -addnode=127.0.0.1
```

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it will run two instances of the daemon

Author: Alright#0419
Content: `komodo-cli` will work with the daemon that has default rpc port set

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you'll need to use curl to interact with the other daemon

Author: Alright#0419
Content: does that make sense?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I need to go shortly, hoping I can get you situated before that though

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: It totally makes sense, its like configuring a mining pool right?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: not quite?

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
basically do 
`./komodod -ac_name=MYCHAIN -ac_supply=999999 -ac_reward=1000000000 -ac_cc=2 -ac_cclib=soduku -addnode=127.0.0.1`

open another terminal and do

`./komodod -ac_name=MYCHAIN -ac_supply=999999 -ac_reward=1000000000 -ac_cc=2 -ac_cclib=soduku -datadir="/<user>/.komodo2" -rpcport=1234 -listen=0 -addnode=127.0.0.1`

then do 
`komodo-cli -ac_name=MYCHAIN setgenerate true 2`
